column18: 05/19/2016: An explosive device detonated shortly after being removed from a bus in Wroclaw, Poland. At least one person was injured in the blast. An anti-immigrant extremist, identified as Pawel R., claimed responsibility for the attack.
column64: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that the attack may have been related to Pawel R.'s anti-immigration sentiments.
column97: A homemade explosive device containing nails was used in the attack.
column126: \\"\"Poland's suspect in home-made bomb blast confesses"
column129: 2016.\",\"\"\"Bomb explodes seconds after being removed from Polish bus"
column132: 2016.\",\"\"\"Polish police detain suspect in home-made bomb blast"

column17: The incident occurred in the Wlochy neighborhood.
column18: 05/23/2016: Three assailants were arrested while planting explosive devices under police vehicles in Warsaw, Masovia, Poland. Police later neutralized the explosive devices. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anarchists.
column97: A homemade explosive device containing flammable liquids was used in the attack.
column126: \\"\"3 Polish men held for planting explosive under police cars"
column129: 2016.\",\"\"\"�Anarchists� arrested after trying to blow up police cars"

column18: 02/15/2017: An explosive device detonated at a police station in Klodawa, Greater Poland, Poland. There were no reported casualties, though the building was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
column97: A two-kilogram homemade explosive device was used in the attack.
column108: A police station was damaged in this attack.
